trans-unit.target: TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_SEQ_00<tab>Togene has a soft spot for children.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TODO_00<tab>Search for any lost children.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TODO_01<tab>Report to Togene.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_000<tab>Have you by any chance come for a walk around the market?
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_001<tab>I look after families' children while they shop here. I also keep my eyes open for any children that get separated from their parents.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_002<tab>If you happen to come across any lost boys and girls please tell them to come here.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_003<tab>If you happen to come across any lost boys and girls please tell them to come here.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_CHILDRENA02759_000_010<tab>You say there's a nice lady that will look after me? I will go and search for her now!
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_CHILDRENA02759_000_011<tab>By the way, have you seen any other children that look like me?
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_CHILDRENB02759_000_012<tab>I had no idea there was a lady like that. I will go and play with her until Daddy finishes his work!
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_CHILDRENB02759_000_013<tab>Though I do wish I knew where my brother had gone off to. Maybe he's with the lady already.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_CHILDRENC02759_000_016<tab>What are you talking about? I'm not lost!
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_CHILDRENC02759_000_017<tab>There's a lady here who looks after lost children? Maybe I'll go and speak with her... But not because I'm lost or anything!
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_020<tab>I have had three children come saying you sent them to me. I was only supposed to be looking after one today, but things have gotten quite lively.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_021<tab>I never cease to be amazed by how friendly Xaela children are with each other. Tribal boundaries mean nothing to them.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_022<tab>This group alone contains a pair of Himaa twins, a Boliri girl, and the Bayaqud child that was here from the start.

TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_100_022<tab>Their tribes are all so different. One of every three Himaa pregnancies results in twins just like these two. Bayaqud women have a tradition of taking multiple husbands.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_110_022<tab>And the Bolir support themselves by collecting dung, drying it, and turning it into charcoal which they then sell to other tribes.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_023<tab>They have all been brought up so differently and yet they get along so well. Some days I wish we adults could behave the same.
TEXT_STMBDZ508_02759_TOGENE_000_024<tab>Regardless, that is of no concern to a traveler such as yourself. Thank you for your help.
